actor_awards.notes: A titan of the American stage and screen, she held the record for the most competitive Tony Awards won by an actress (five) for many years. She won Emmys for 'Little Moon of Alban', 'Victoria Regina', and providing the voice in 'Not for Ourselves Alone'. She was a Kennedy Center Honoree in 2005.

filmography.title: The Member of the Wedding
filmography.role_description: A lonely, tomboyish 12-year-old girl in the South who becomes obsessed with her brother's wedding, hoping to join the couple on their honeymoon.
filmography.plot: A 12-year-old tomboy feels disconnected from her life and becomes obsessed with her brother's upcoming wedding.

filmography.title: East of Eden
filmography.role_description: The compassionate girlfriend of Aaron Trask who finds herself drawn to his troubled brother Cal (James Dean).
filmography.plot: A wayward young man competes for the affection of his religious father with his favored brother, uncovering family secrets along the way.

filmography.title: The Haunting
filmography.role_description: A fragile, psychic woman who becomes the primary focus of the supernatural forces within Hill House.
filmography.plot: A scientist invites three people to a haunted house to investigate supernatural phenomenon, but the house begins to prey on one of them.
filmography.awards: Golden Globe: Nomination – Best Director (Robert Wise)

filmography.title: I Am a Camera
filmography.role_description: A carefree, hedonistic cabaret singer living in Berlin during the rise of the Nazi party. Harris originated this role on Broadway.
filmography.plot: An English writer in 1930s Berlin befriends a flamboyant cabaret singer as the Nazis rise to power.

filmography.title: Requiem for a Heavyweight
filmography.role_description: A sympathetic employment counselor who tries to help a washed-up boxer find a new life outside the ring.
filmography.plot: A heavyweight boxer faces the end of his career and the corruption of his manager.

filmography.title: Reflections in a Golden Eye
filmography.role_description: The neurotic and depressed wife of an Army officer who cut off her nipples with garden shears.
filmography.plot: Private passions and repressed homosexuality cause tensions to explode at a Southern army base.

filmography.title: Harper
filmography.role_description: A lounge singer and junkie involved in the mystery investigated by private eye Lew Harper.
filmography.plot: Private investigator Lew Harper is hired by a wealthy woman to investigate the disappearance of her husband.

filmography.title: The Hiding Place
filmography.role_description: The devoutly religious sister of Corrie ten Boom who maintains her faith while imprisoned in a concentration camp.
filmography.plot: During WWII, a Dutch family hides Jews from the Nazis but are eventually betrayed and sent to concentration camps.
filmography.awards: Golden Globe: Nomination – Best Supporting Actress (Film - Lee Remick)

filmography.title: Gorillas in the Mist
filmography.role_description: An American expatriate in Rwanda who befriends Dian Fossey.
filmography.plot: The true story of Dian Fossey, a scientist who came to Africa to study the vanishing mountain gorillas, and later fought to protect them.

filmography.title: You're a Big Boy Now
filmography.role_description: The repressive landlady who houses the young protagonist.
filmography.plot: A young man moves to New York City to find life and love, but is pursued by his overbearing parents.

filmography.title: Voyage of the Damned
filmography.role_description: A wealthy passenger on the SS St. Louis, a ship carrying Jewish refugees fleeing Nazi Germany.
filmography.plot: Jewish refugees fleeing Nazi Germany on an ocean liner are refused entry by Cuba and the US, forcing them to return to Europe.

filmography.title: The Split
filmography.role_description: A member of a criminal gang involved in a heist during a football game.
filmography.plot: A thief recruits a team to rob the LA Coliseum during a Rams game, but internal conflicts threaten the getaway.

filmography.title: The People Next Door
filmography.role_description: A suburban mother dealing with the counterculture movement and drug addiction in her family.
filmography.plot: Two suburban families cope with the generation gap and their children's involvement with drugs.

filmography.title: Housesitter
filmography.role_description: The mother of Steve Martin's character, who is charmed by the imposter housesitter.
filmography.plot: A con artist moves into an architect's empty house and convinces his family and town that she is his wife.

filmography.title: The Dark Half
filmography.role_description: A colleague who helps the protagonist investigate his dark alter ego.
filmography.plot: A writer's fictional alter ego manifests in reality and begins a murder spree to prevent being 'killed off'.

filmography.title: Carried Away
filmography.role_description: The dying mother of a rural schoolteacher who is having a midlife crisis.
filmography.plot: A schoolteacher's mundane life is upended when he begins an affair with a 17-year-old student.

filmography.title: The Truth About Women
filmography.role_description: One of the women in the life of the protagonist, recounting his romantic history.
filmography.plot: An elderly diplomat recalls his many loves to his son-in-law to save the latter's marriage.

filmography.title: The Poacher's Daughter
filmography.role_description: A woman who tries to stop her husband from following in his poacher father's footsteps.
filmography.plot: A young Irish wife struggles to keep her husband from the easy life of poaching and laziness.

filmography.title: The Bell Jar
filmography.role_description: The mother of the troubled protagonist, Esther Greenwood, in this adaptation of Sylvia Plath's novel.
filmography.plot: A young woman's summer internship at a magazine in New York leads to a mental breakdown upon her return home.

filmography.title: Bad Ronald
filmography.role_description: The mother who hides her son in a secret room in their house after he accidentally kills a neighbor. (TV Movie)
filmography.plot: A teenage boy who accidentally kills a peer is hidden in a secret room by his mother, where he descends into madness.

filmography.title: Home for the Holidays
filmography.role_description: A woman whose father suspects his second wife is trying to kill him in this early slasher TV movie. (TV Movie)
filmography.plot: An ill man summons his daughters home for Christmas, suspecting his new wife is poisoning him, but a pitchfork-wielding killer intervenes.

filmography.title: The Belle of Amherst
filmography.role_description: A one-woman show portraying the life and poetry of Emily Dickinson. (TV Movie)
filmography.plot: A filmed performance of the one-woman play about the life of poet Emily Dickinson.
filmography.awards: Grammy: Win – Best Spoken Word Recording

filmography.title: Little Moon of Alban
filmography.role_description: A volunteer nurse in Dublin during the Irish War of Independence who falls in love with an English soldier. (TV Movie)
filmography.plot: An Irish girl whose fiancé is killed by the British finds herself nursing a British officer back to health.
filmography.awards: Primetime Emmy: Win – Best Single Performance by an Actress

filmography.title: Victoria Regina
filmography.role_description: Portrays the British monarch throughout her long reign in this Hallmark Hall of Fame production. (TV Movie)
filmography.plot: A dramatization of the life and reign of Queen Victoria.
filmography.awards: Primetime Emmy: Win – Outstanding Single Performance by an Actress in a Leading Role

filmography.title: How Awful About Allan
filmography.role_description: The sister of a man who is released from a mental hospital after being blinded in a fire. (TV Movie)
filmography.plot: A guilt-ridden blind man returns home from a mental institution to live with his sister, but begins to hear strange noises.

filmography.title: The Lightkeepers
filmography.role_description: A supporting role in her final feature film.
filmography.plot: A film set in Cape Cod in 1912 about two lighthouse keepers who have sworn off women.
